skill.name: github-actions-templates
skill.description: Create production-ready GitHub Actions workflows for automated testing, building, and deploying applications. Use when setting up CI/CD with GitHub Actions, automating development workflows, or creating reusable workflow templates.
skill.summary: Create production-ready GitHub Actions workflows for automated testing, building, and deploying appl...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill contains static documentation and workflow examples only. No executable code, file access, environment access, or network behavior is present in the skill files.

content.value_statement: CI/CD workflows are time consuming to write and easy to misconfigure. This skill provides proven GitHub Actions templates for tests, builds, deployments, and security scans.
actual_capabilities: Provide a Node.js test workflow with caching and coverage upload
Provide a Docker build and push workflow to GHCR
Provide a Kubernetes deployment workflow using AWS credentials
Provide a matrix build workflow across OS and Python versions
Provide a reusable workflow pattern with inputs and secrets
Provide security scanning workflow examples with Trivy and Snyk
limitations: Does not execute or validate workflows in your repository
Does not create or manage GitHub secrets or cloud credentials
Does not replace infrastructure specific deployment scripts
Does not cover every language, runtime, or cloud provider

use_cases.title: Launch a CI baseline
use_cases.description: Start with a test and lint workflow for a new repository and keep builds reliable.

use_cases.title: Standardize pipelines
use_cases.description: Reuse templates for Docker builds, approvals, and reusable workflows across teams.

use_cases.title: Add security scans
use_cases.description: Adopt Trivy and Snyk workflow examples to catch vulnerabilities early.

prompt_templates.title: Starter test flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that runs npm ci, lint, and tests on pushes and pull requests using Node 20.

prompt_templates.title: Docker build publish
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a workflow to build and push a Docker image to GHCR with tags for branches and semver releases.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a workflow that configures AWS credentials and deploys manifests from k8s/ to production.

prompt_templates.title: Reusable test workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a reusable workflow that accepts node-version input and uses NPM_TOKEN for private installs.

output_examples.input: Create a matrix build for Python 3.9 to 3.12 on Linux, macOS, and Windows.
output: Runs on ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, and windows-latest
Installs dependencies with pip and runs pytest
Triggers on push and pull requests

best_practices: Pin action versions instead of using latest
Use secrets for tokens and credentials
Limit workflow permissions to the minimum needed
anti_patterns: Using unpinned actions from unknown sources
Storing credentials directly in workflow files
Deploying to production without approval gates

faq.question: What platforms are compatible?
faq.answer: Works with GitHub Actions. Use the templates in Claude, Codex, or Claude Code for drafting.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Templates are examples and may need edits for your stack, repo paths, or cloud setup.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my repo?
faq.answer: Copy the workflow into .github/workflows and adjust triggers, secrets, and commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill provides static templates and does not read or transmit your files or secrets.

faq.question: What if a workflow fails?
faq.answer: Check logs, verify action versions, and confirm required secrets and permissions.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing from scratch?
faq.answer: It saves time by starting from proven patterns while still allowing customization.
